intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. toplicense, commonly known as the common meadow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. The plant features basal and cauline leaves that are lanceolate to ovate, with hairy surfaces. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a composite head, characteristic of the Asteraceae family. The subspecies is distinguished by its finely hairy stems and leaves, contributing to its identification in the field.
